metadata.title: CVE-2019-16413 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.4. The 9p filesystemdid not protect i_size_write() properly, which causes an i_size_read()infinite loop and denial of service on SMP systems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16413` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-148-generic - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-lowlatency - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-148-generic - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-148-lowlatency - 4.4.0-148.174
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1046-kvm - 4.4.0-1046.52
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1083-aws - 4.4.0-1083.93
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1107-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1107.115
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1111-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1111.116
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1008-fips - 4.4.0-1008.10
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1008-fips - 4.4.0-1008.10
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1008-fips - 4.4.0-1008.10
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1008-fips - 4.4.0-1008.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-148.174').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1046.52').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1083.93').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.115').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1111.116').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1008.10').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
